headline: Lives in Contradiction: Leonardo Da Vinci and Aleksandr
description: The third entry in the 'Lives in Contradiction' series contrasts the universal mind of Leonardo da Vinci with the recursive self-examination of Aleksandr, drawing out the tension between vast outer curiosity and intimate inner recursion.
timeFelt: Playful awe mixed with self-conscious contrast—daring to juxtapose oneself with the vastness of genius.
resonantThread: Continues the pattern begun in previous 'Lives in Contradiction' entries, this time moving from cultural icons to personal introspection.
whyItMatters: This post bravely puts the author into direct comparison with a figure of towering intellect—not to claim parity, but to explore what we learn about both when we let contrast illuminate contradiction.
